HUMAN.Cystic fibrosis ( CF ) recessive autosomal genetic disease exocrine glands secrete highly viscous mucus . Variable genetic penetrance ( `` organ sparing '' ) results broad spectrum clinical presentations . The diagnosis CF usually established presence chronic obstructive lung disease and/or gastrointestinal dysfunction , together elevated levels sweat electrolytes ( chloride > 60 mEq/liter ) , markedly diminished duodenal pancreatic enzyme concentrations , pathologic changes tissue . Family history may occasionally helpful . The metabolic basis CF unknown . The classic stereotype CF patient infant chronic cough , diarrhea , growth failure . Improved medical care enabling many patients reach adulthood , increased diagnostic suspicion resulting identification disease adults . Based upon analysis 11,000 cases CF reported year 1974 119 Cystic Fibrosis Centers , National Cystic Fibrosis Foundation estimated probability individual CF surviving age 20 approximately 39 % . Although adults currently care pediatricians , development medical , psychiatric , surgical , obstetric complications may necessitate involvement professionals . A joint study cystic fibrosis adults conducted Duke Medical Center NIH shown majority affected adults , including diagnosed early life , married work full- part-time . Many manifest symptoms relatively late life . Since study retrospective , reported frequencies clinical findings tend underestimate , instances , actual incidence population studied . The reported incidence CF United States conservatively estimated 1:2,000 live births . If adults clubbing , infertility , symptoms evaluated CF , true incidence would certainly higher .
